intro: Corydalis nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stem corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, often leafless stems and clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in specialty gardens for its ornamental value.
